com.github.bordertech.wcomponents.validation

Class ValidatingAction

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.bordertech.wcomponents.validation.ValidatingAction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Action, Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    WMessagesValidatingAction

    public abstract class ValidatingAction
extends Object
implements Action
    This class calls a components validation logic prior to executing its underlying action logic. If there are no validation errors then the executeOnValid() method is called. This allows for the validation logic to be seperated from the action logic.

    Users should provide a subclass of this as the action to perform on any WButtons that should trigger validation. The code to run when validation has passed is to be provided in the executeOnValid() method.

    Author:
    Adam Millard
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • ValidatingAction

        public ValidatingAction(WValidationErrors errorsBox,
                WComponent componentToValidate)
        Creates a ValidatingAction. Note that any visible components within the componentToValidate will also be validated.
        Parameters:
        errorsBox - the validation errors box which will display any validation errors.
        componentToValidate - the component to be validated for this action.

    • Method Detail

        Parameters:
        errorsBox - the validation errors box which will display any validation errors.

      • setComponentToValidate

        public void setComponentToValidate(WComponent componentToValidate)
        Sets the component to validate. Note that any visible components within the component will also be validated.
        Parameters:
        componentToValidate - the component to be validated for this action.

      • getComponentToValidate

        public WComponent getComponentToValidate()
        Returns:
        the component to be validated for this action.

      • validate

        public void validate(List<Diagnostic> diags)
        This method can be overridden to perform additional validations, but don't forget to call super.validate if you still want to perform default validation.
        Parameters:
        diags - the list into which any validation diagnostics are added.

      • executeOnValid

        public abstract void executeOnValid(ActionEvent event)
        This method is called if no errors are found from validation.
        Parameters:
        event - the action event which triggered this action.

      • executeOnError

        public void executeOnError(ActionEvent event,
                  List<Diagnostic> diags)

        This method is called if errors are found from validation.

        This method can be overriden, but don't forget to call super.executeOnError if you still want to see error messages.

        Parameters:
        event - the action event which triggered this action.
        diags - the list into which any validation diagnostics were added.

        This method is invoked when an action occurs.

        Parameters:
        event - details about the event that occured.
